rename.from: issue: FieldErrors Type Can't Handle Optional Array Property
rename.to: issue: FieldErrors Type Can't Handle Optional Properties

body: I think this was discussed in #8518

issue.title: fix #8584: field errors type with optional fields

repository.name: react-hook-form
repository.description: ðŸ“‹ React Hooks for form state management and validation (Web + React Native)

body:
Hey @impzero , after reading the discussions it sounds to me like it's a different issue. Eventually, the root cause might be the same but that's unlikely, I guess. In my case, I'm not dealing with an `any` type but the new `Merge` construct from v7.33.0 (released after the linked discussion was created). This `Merge` somehow completely ignores optional properties, as they are not defined at all.

So in my example above, `errors.foo?` should have the type `FieldError | FieldErrors<{ bar: string }> | undefined` but instead it's only `FieldError | undefined`.

issue.title: issue: Typescript error on optional nested fields after upgrading to 7.33.0

repository.name: react-hook-form
repository.description: ðŸ“‹ React Hooks for form state management and validation (Web + React Native)

issue.body:
### Version Number

7.33.0

### Codesandbox/Expo snack

https://codesandbox.io/s/serverless-night-lm12sl?file=/src/App.tsx

### Steps to reproduce

1. Go to 'https://codesandbox.io/s/serverless-night-lm12sl?file=/src/App.tsx'
2. Investigate typescript error on line 21
3. Revert react hook form version to 7.32.2
4. No more error


### Expected behaviour

There is no typescript error when using the latest version on a nested type that the parent is optional.

### What browsers are you seeing the problem on?

_No response_

### Relevant log output

_No response_

### Code of Conduct

- [X] I agree to follow this project's Code of Conduct

issue.title: issue: API Breakage on FieldErrors when using joiResolver

repository.name: react-hook-form
repository.description: ðŸ“‹ React Hooks for form state management and validation (Web + React Native)

issue.body:
### Version Number

7.33.1

### Codesandbox/Expo snack

https://codesandbox.io/s/reverent-pond-doojbz?file=/src/App.tsx

### Steps to reproduce

1. Go to the codesandbox example
3. Scroll down to the line 57
4. See type error


### Expected behaviour

We should not get the type error

### What browsers are you seeing the problem on?

Firefox, Chrome

### Relevant log output

```shell
Element implicitly has an 'any' type because expression of type '"frequency"' can't be used to index type 'FieldErrorsImpl<DeepRequired<PricingPlan>>'.
Property 'frequency' does not exist on type 'FieldErrorsImpl<DeepRequired<PricingPlan>>'.
```


### Code of Conduct

- [X] I agree to follow this project's Code of Conduct
